6.  This section is a consideration of the generalized conjugate of a compact operator in the event Z is assumed to be reflexive.  Recall that a topological linear space is quasi- complete iff each bounded Cauchy net is convergent.  It is easy to see that a B-space is weakly quasi-complete iff it is reflexive.  The following lemma follows readily from the principle of uniform boundedness. 
6.  1 Lemma.  If X and Z are B-spaces,  a set В ^ T Z '- bounded if it is
norm bounded. 
6.  2 Lemma.  Let X and Z be B-spaces with Z reflexive.  Then ( X +, TZ ') is quasi- complete. 
Proof.  Suffices by 6.  1 to show that the unit sphere,  / S ', of X + is TZ '- complete.  Let {^ а } а € л ^ S ' be a TZ '- Cauchy net.  Then { 7 " a ^} ae ^ ^ bounded weak Cauchy net in Z
for each X ^ which converges to a unique limit î € Z since Z is reflexive. 
Define T \ X ^ Z by T { x ) = $ { x ^ X ). Such T is clearly linear and well-defined.  In order to show that T is continuous,  it suffices to show that z ' T is continuous for each z ' € Z '. In fact,  if z ' € Z ', a > 0,  and { a :«} -> 0,  there is an a 6 A such that b ^ a implies \ z ' Tb — z ' Tc \ < e / 3.  The corresponding Ta is continuous,  so there is an N such that n ^ N implies | | ^ 1,  I z ' TaXn | < e / 3.  Let n ^ N.  Since T ^ Xn- ^ Txn
weakly,  there is an ^ a such that an implies | z ' TaXn — z ' Txn \ < e / 3.  Then

Hence z ' T is continuous. 
Now { Ta }-^ r ( TZ '), for if z '€ Z ', z ' T ^ x- ^ z ' Tx ( x ^ X ), i.  e.  { z ' Ta ]-^ z ' T in the weak star topology on X '. But is Cauchy and X ' is complete,  so z ' T ^-^ z ' ^ X '
for each z ' € Z '. Then certainly z ' T ^-^ z ' ( weak star ). The weak star topology on X ' is Hausdorff,  so?  = z ' T ( z '^ Z '). Thus r ( TZ ').
Need T S.  But
I Г I = sup \ Tx \ = sup sup \ z ' Tx \ = sup sup | |

= sup \ z ' T \ = sup lim \ z ' Toc \ ^ sup \ z ' \ = 1.

Thus S is ( TZ ') - complete. 
Let X be a normed linear space and W a topological linear space.  A map T : X- ^ W is compact iff T ( S ) is conditionally compact.  In the light of this definition, 
6.  2 and 5.  5 combine to give a slightly more satisfactory result. 
6.  3 Corollary.  Let X,  Г,  and Z be B-spaces with Z reflexive.  Then a map A : X -> 7 is compact iff A + : У + ( X +, TZ ') is compact. 
In the event dim ( Z ) < oo,  this result takes a much simpler form. 
6.  4 Corollary.  Let X,  7,  and Z be B-spaces with Z finite-dimensional.  Then a map A : X- > Y is compact iff У "*" -» X + is compact. 
Proof.  If Z is finite-dimensional,  the Z '- operator topology on X + coincides with the norm topology. 
The following useful lemma appears as [ 1,  VI.  9.  6 ].
